title: Control Severe Bleeding
brief: Stop life-threatening bleeding using direct pressure and pressure dressings.
steps: Step 1: Apply firm direct pressure over the wound immediately.
Step 2: Maintain pressure for at least 30 minutes to seal damaged surfaces.
Step 3: If bleeding continues after 30 minutes, apply a pressure dressing.
Step 4: Place thick gauze dressing directly over wound.
Step 5: Wrap tightly with bandage - tighter than normal compression but not cutting circulation.
Step 6: Do not remove blood-soaked dressing - add more layers on top.
Step 7: Leave pressure dressing in place for 1-2 days.
Step 8: After 1-2 days, remove and replace with smaller dressing.
Step 9: Make daily dressing changes and inspect for infection signs.
warnings: Loss of 1 liter of blood causes shock; 2 liters causes severe shock; 3 liters is usually fatal.
Arterial bleeding (bright red, spurting) is most dangerous and can be fatal within minutes.
